newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan '97 rubber output for tyres seen rising-body.
newsitem.headline: Japan '97 rubber output for tyres seen rising-body.

text.p: A Japanese tyre makers' association on Thursday revised upwards its forecast of Japan's rubber output for tyres in 1997 on expectations of growth in the country's car exports.

Japan's rubber output for tyres in calendar 1997 is likely to total 1.105 million tonnes, up from an earlier forecast of 1.060 million tonnes, the Japan Automobile Tyre Manufacturers' Association said.
The revised figures represent a three percent increase from actual output in 1996.
The association said in a statement that the yen's weaker tendency against the dollar would push up Japan's automobile exports, creating greater rubber demand for tyres.
Of the total, rubber production for tyres intended for exports in 1997 is expected to reach 461,000 tonnes, up by 3.4 percent from a year earlier, the association said.
The association said that increasing tyre exports to developing countries was expected to support growth.
